# Draft:Scott Woodward (marketer)

----
Scott Woodward is an American marketing executive..He is the founder of the brand consultancy SEW Branded and has held executive positions with businesses such as the Arnell Group, Movado Group, Calvin Klein, and Ray-Ban
Education
Woodward earned an MBA from Loyola University New Orleans in 1987 after earning a BA in business and management from Saint Leo University in 1986.  Also, he finished his graduate studies at Villanova University.
Career
Woodward began his career at Chevron in 1987 as a marketing assistant. He later became director of global image marketing at Ray-Ban.
In 1997, Woodward became vice president of worldwide marketing and public relations at Calvin Klein in 1997.  He worked on brand campaigns for Tommy Hilfiger, Coach, Concord, ESQ, and Movado before joining Movado Group as global chief marketing officer the following year.  Later that, he worked for the Arnell Group after Omnicom acquired it.
In 2021, Woodward became an adjunct professor at The New School's Parsons School of Design, where he taught consumer branding classes.  He wrote an essay about actress Farrah Fawcett to People magazine in 2024.  He developed a 2025 PSA for the Luisa Diaz Foundation that included Dina and Ali Lohan, Candace Bushnell, and Nick Adams, among other New Yorkers.
Philanthropy & Awards
The Hetrick-Martin Institute presented Woodward with the Emery Award in 2013 for his efforts to raise money for anti-bullying education.  In 2014, campaigns developed by SEW Branded in partnership with One Direction and the Born This Way Foundation won Clio, Summit International, and Internet Advertising Awards.
In 2025, Woodward produced a public service announcement for the Luisa Diaz Foundation that premiered at the Mia Amor Graciousness Gala in New York. Women’s Wear Daily reported that the campaign promoted kindness as a leadership quality. The same year, he received the “Kindness is Cool” award from the foundation. Media outlets including Times Square Chronicles and Daily Front Row covered the campaign and his remarks at the event.
